entry.title: EDIRD: Why Do Birds Suddenly Appear
entry.content: Speaking of cinema: Mirrormask was quite a thing. For one thing, giving Dave McKean millions of dollars to make a movie results in visual deliciousness. For another thing, looking back, I see this prefiguring a bunch of my friends' kinks. Hello clockwork robot mind-control scene with a hint of transformation!

entry.title: Electronica Will Eat Itself
entry.content:
This is a nifty video of a musical robot—but it’s also a great example of how all culture builds on what came before, how all culture is to some extent remix culture. It’s a robot that physically plays a set of instruments that correspond to the TR-808, which itself was a way of synthetically producing the sounds of that set of instruments. Always we are consuming what came before; sometimes we are making it our own and new, and ideally we are giving it freely to a future that needs it just as badly as we need our own past.

(via)
